nodes.text: Coachelle Automata was a company that manufactured the LEP servant droid. Initially the droid was meant to serve as a childcare unit, but after it failed to find success in this capacity, it was tweaked and relaunched by Coachelle Automata as a service droid. The droid was manufactured in the same complex as Cybot Galactica's PK-series worker droid, which it proved to be only slightly less popular than.

Coachelle Automata was first mentioned in the new Star Wars canon in the 2018 De Agostini magazine Star Wars: Build Your Own R2-D2 65. The company originated in Star Wars Legends, where it was first mentioned in the 2009 reference book Star Wars: The Clone Wars: Visual Guide Ultimate Battles, which was written by Jason Fry.
